Class CustomPortalServiceHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.fraunhofer.fokus.oefit.adhoc.custom.CustomPortalServiceHandler

  • public class CustomPortalServiceHandler
extends Object
    Custom utility methods for tasks related to portal datastructures

      Gets the value for a given configuration key (or the default setting if not found) This method may either access the portlet data-source for local settings or the portal properties for global configuration settings

      Checks if is system initialized.
      static void saveConfig(javax.portlet.ActionRequest request)
      Save a set of configuration changes right from the portlet request The request is parsed for configuration values with names out of E_ConfigKey As a result, social media plugins and messagec composers will be reinitialized to address the changes

    • Method Detail

      • changeUserProfile

        public static void changeUserProfile(com.liferay.portal.model.User oldUser,
                     ProfileForm newProfile,
                     org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result)
        Validates a given form object and changes user settings accordingly
        Parameters:
        oldUser - the old Liferay user model
        newProfile - the profile containing new values
        result - the message handler to bind validation errors to

      • checkInit

        public static void checkInit(com.liferay.portal.theme.ThemeDisplay themeDisplay)
        Provides an entry point to initialize basic settings and data-structures. Due to use of Liferay's document library and permission settings, this should be run only on login by an administrator.
        Parameters:
        themeDisplay - the theme display of the administrator

      • checkRole

        public static com.liferay.portal.model.Role checkRole(long companyId,
                                      String roleName)
        Check for a specific role name and create a regular role if not existent
        Parameters:
        companyId - the company Id of the given role
        roleName - the role name
        Returns:
        the role

      • createPortalUser

        public static com.liferay.portal.model.User createPortalUser(String firstName,
                                             String lastName,
                                             String mail,
                                             long companyId,
                                             Locale locale)
        Creates a new portal user
        Parameters:
        firstName - the first name
        lastName - the last name
        mail - the email address
        companyId - the company id
        locale - the user's locale
        Returns:
        the user object

      • getConfigValue

        public static String getConfigValue(E_ConfigKey key)
        Gets the value for a given configuration key (or the default setting if not found) This method may either access the portlet data-source for local settings or the portal properties for global configuration settings
        Parameters:
        key - the configuration key
        Returns:
        the configuration value

      • hasUser

        public static boolean hasUser(long companyId,
              String mail)
        Check whether a given user exists
        Parameters:
        companyId - the company id
        mail - the email address of the user in question
        Returns:
        true, if the user exists, false otherwise

      • isSystemInitialized

        public static boolean isSystemInitialized()
        Checks if is system initialized. Uses a portlet configuration setting to determine, if #checkInit()) checkInit was called before.
        Returns:
        true, if #checkInit()) checkInit was successfully called before

      • saveConfig

        public static void saveConfig(javax.portlet.ActionRequest request)
        Save a set of configuration changes right from the portlet request The request is parsed for configuration values with names out of E_ConfigKey As a result, social media plugins and messagec composers will be reinitialized to address the changes
        Parameters:
        request - the portlet request

      • setConfig

        public static void setConfig(E_ConfigKey key,
             String value)
        Set a given configuration value
        Parameters:
        key - the configuration key
        value - the configuration value
